required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Additive Effect of Twice-daily Brinzolamide 1%/Brimonidine 0.2%Combination as an Adjunctive Therapy to Travoprost in Patients With Normal Tension Glaucoma
clinical_study.official_title: A 6-week, Double Masked, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Twice-daily Brinzolamide 1%/Brimonidine 0.2% Fixed Dose Combination as an Adjunctive Therapy to Travoprost 0.004% in Reducing Intraocular Pressure in Patients With Normal Tension Glaucoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to determine the incremental intraocular pressure (IOP) lowering that is achieved when Simbrinza is used adjunctively to Travatan in patients with normal tension glaucoma that may benefit from further IOP lowering.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was prematurely terminated due to administrative reasons and not due to any safety or efficacy concerns.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This was a multicenter, randomized, double-masked, two-arm, placebo-controlled, parallel group study in patients with normal tension glaucoma who were insufficiently controlled on travoprost 0.004% (Travatan) monotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Diurnal IOP at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry in millimeters mercury (mmHg). Diurnal IOP was defined as the average of the 9:00 am and 11:00 am time points. A more negative change value indicates a greater amount of improvement. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in IOP at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP was measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry in mmHg. A more negative percent change value indicates a greater amount of improvement. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
IOP was measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry in mmHg. Diurnal IOP was defined as the average of the 9:00 and 11:00 time points. One (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in IOP for Each Time Point at Week 6
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (9:00 am and 11:00 am), Week 6 (9:00 am and 11:00 am)
secondary_outcome.description: IOP was measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry in mmHg. A more negative change value indicates a greater amount of improvement. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in IOP for Each Time Point at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP was measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry in mmHg. A more negative percent change value indicates a greater amount of improvement. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

arm_group.description: Brinzolamide 1%/brimonidine 0.2% fixed combination + travoprost 0.004% ophthalmic solution

intervention.description: One drop applied topically to the affected eye(s) in the morning and evening
One drop applied topically to the affected eye(s) in the morning and evening
One drop applied topically to the affected eye(s) in the evening

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sign written informed consent
- Diagnosed with normal tension glaucoma
- Intraocular pressure measurements in at least 1 eye as specified in the protocol
- Willing and able to attend all study visits
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of hypersensitivity to any of the study drugs
- Use of medications prohibited by the protocol
- Pregnant or nursing
- Of child-bearing potential unless using contraception, as specified in the protocol
- Any form of glaucoma other than open angle glaucoma in either eye
- Chronic, recurrent or severe inflammatory eye disease
- Ocular trauma or surgery within the past 6 months in either eye; ocular infection or laser surgery within the past 3 months in either eye (all from screening)
- Conditions which would make the patient, in the opinion of the Investigator, unsuitable for the study.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All randomized patients (1). Note: No patients were randomized to the Simbrinza + Travatan arm.

group.title: Simbrinza + Travatan
group.description: Brinzolamide 1%/brimonidine 0.2% fixed combination (morning and evening) + travoprost 0.004% ophthalmic solution (evening)

group.title: Placebo + Travatan
group.description: Placebo (morning and evening) + travoprost 0.004% ophthalmic solution (evening)

baseline.population: No patients were enrolled in the Simbrinza + Travatan arm.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Diurnal IOP at Week 6
outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry in millimeters mercury (mmHg). Diurnal IOP was defined as the average of the 9:00 am and 11:00 am time points. A more negative change value indicates a greater amount of improvement. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: At the time of the premature termination of this study, only 1 patient was randomized. Therefore, the planned efficacy and safety analyses could not be performed. No data to report.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) were collected from First Patient First Visit (FPFV) until Last Patient Last Visit (LPLV). All AEs reported in this record are from date of First Patient First Treatment until Last Patient Last Visit) up to approximately six weeks.
reported_events.desc: The Safety analysis set included all patients exposed to at least one dose of any study therapy. Note: Number at risk for Simbrinza + Travatan is reported as 0 because no patients were exposed to this study therapy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
